page.title: 07Sports ground, Kesgrave
page.content: In our area there are a number of sports grounds owned by Ipswich firms and provided by them as sports facilities for their employees. Fisons, a chemicals and fertilizer company, own one of the sports grounds. They purchased the land which covers more than 11 acres in 1951. Previously it was just barren land. Fisons, part of a large Norwegian company, employ about 900 people in Ipswich and about 350 people come to the sports complex each week. Employees of the firm are allowed to bring their friends and relatives as well. The facilities available include bowls, football pitches, tennis courts hockey pitch, pool, snooker and table tennis. The firm would also like to build a swimming pool and squash court. Fisons have four football teams and four bowls teams in local competitions.
